cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the central Texas coast (Corpus Christi–Port O’Connor area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Corpus Christi / Port O'Connor, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas Gulf Coast from Brownsville to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small chance (3% cumulative) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely peak 20–25 kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible, generally below 3 ft above ground level along the upper Texas coast and Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Saturday into early Sunday with 3–5 inches possible, locally higher; risk of urban flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Friday night.
